00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Coredump interface and definitions
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision$<hr>
00046  */
00047 #ifndef __CVMX_COREDUMP_H__
00048 #define __CVMX_COREDUMP_H__
00049 
00050 #include "cvmx-debug.h"
00051 
00052 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00053 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00054 extern "C" {
00055 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #define CVMX_COREDUMP_BLK_NAME  "cvmx-coredump"
00059 
00060 /* Use the same interface for the coredump as the debugger stub uses. */
00061 typedef cvmx_debug_core_context_t cvmx_coredump_registers_t;
00062 typedef cvmx_debug_tlb_t cvmx_coredump_tlb_t;
00063 
00064 #define CVMX_COREDUMP_MAX_MEM_DESC    256
00065 
00066 #define CVMX_CORE_DUMP_MAGIC_PART(A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H) \
00067     ((((uint64_t)A & 0xff) << 56) | (((uint64_t)B & 0xff) << 48) | (((uint64_t)C & 0xff) << 40)  | (((uint64_t)D & 0xff) << 32) | \
00068      (((uint64_t)E & 0xff) << 24) | (((uint64_t)F & 0xff) << 16) | (((uint64_t)G & 0xff) << 8)   | (((uint64_t)H & 0xff)))
00069 #define CVMX_COREDUMP_MAGIC CVMX_CORE_DUMP_MAGIC_PART('C','O','R','E','D','U','M','P')
00070 #define CVMX_COREDUMP_CURRENT_VERSION 2
00071 
00072 typedef struct {
00073     uint64_t valid;
00074     uint64_t base;
00075     uint64_t size;
00076 } cvmx_coredump_memdesc_t;
00077 
00078 typedef struct {
00079     uint64_t num_mem_entry;
00080     cvmx_coredump_memdesc_t meminfo[CVMX_COREDUMP_MAX_MEM_DESC];
00081 } cvmx_coredump_mem_info_t;
00082 
00083 typedef struct
00084 {
00085     uint64_t magic;
00086     uint64_t version;
00087     uint64_t tlb_entries;
00088     cvmx_coredump_mem_info_t mem_dump;
00089     cvmx_coredump_registers_t registers[CVMX_MAX_CORES];
00090 } cvmx_coredump_mem_block_t;
00091 
00092 void cvmx_coredump_init(void);
00093 int cvmx_coredump_start_dump(uint64_t *u);
00094 
00095 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00096 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00097 }
00098 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00099 #endif
00100 
00101 #endif  /* __CVMX_COREDUMP_H__ */
